prompt:
Given the following classification examples, annotate the unlabeled example with a prediction that must correspond to exactly one of the following labels: pos, neg.

Each label is described as follows:
negative: A negative movie review.
positive: A positive movie review.

Text: Midnight Cowboy made a big fuss when it was released in 1969, drawing an X rating. By today's standards, it would be hard pressed to pull an R rating. Jon Voight, who has been better, is competent in his role as Joe Buck, an out of town hick wanting to make it big with the ladies in New York City. He meets a seedy street hustler named Ratso Rizzo, who tries to befriend Buck for his own purposes. The two eventually forge a bond that is both touching and pathetic. As Ratso, Dustin Hoffman simply shines. Hoffman has often been brilliant, but never more so than in this portrayal. He is so into character that all else around him pales in comparison. Losing the Academy Award to John Wayne is one of the most ridiculous decisions ever made by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. Director Schlessinger has a deft hand with his production, but this film has a grungy underbelly that leaves a bad taste in the mouth of the viewer. Worth seeing for Hoffman's performance alone.
Label: pos

Text: {text}
Label:

invocation_context.text: The book starts off slowly, and although it seemed promising at first, it quickly became dull and uninteresting. I wouldn't recommend this book to anyone as it was one of the most boring reads I have ever come across. The only highlight of my reading experience was when I accidentally dropped the book and the pages scattered everywhere, giving me an excuse to stop reading. I can't believe I wasted my time on this book, and I wouldn't be surprised if others felt the same way. Save yourself the trouble and find something else to read instead.

invocation_context.text:
Paulie is a heartwarming tale of a young boy's imagination or perhaps his nostalgic memory of his childhood.

Tony Shaloub delivers an exceptional performance as a struggling artist who forms a bond with a stray cat while working odd jobs in a bustling city.

The main antagonist is a jealous neighbor who becomes threatened by Paulie's talent and tries to sabotage him, leading Paulie to seek refuge in an abandoned theater where he meets the cat.

Paulie reminisces about his past experiences with his best friend Sarah and their adventures together. The journey begins to reunite Paulie with Sarah, but many years have passed.

The film concludes, some may say predictably, with Paulie and Sarah reuniting. The story ends with the two friends walking hand in hand towards a new chapter in their lives.

A heartwarming film for the whole family!
